comments_content.body: Cannot tell why.  The log has lots of gmtserver failures but I dont see any details as to why it fails.  Are you able to run one locally under Windows and get some clues?  I will review the code changes in movie but since it works on macOS and Linux there must be something that is not quite the same for Windows.
@joa-quim, can you test an animation and let me know if there is anything?

Just ran the anim02.sh, it doesn't report any error, but it also don't generate the PS file.

Below is part of the verbose messages.
```
movie [DEBUG]: Found file main.sh
movie [DEBUG]: Found file main.sh
movie [DEBUG]: Found file main.sh
movie [INFORMATION]: Paper dimensions: Width = 3.5i Height = 4.167i

movie [DEBUG]: Object ID 0 : Registered Data Table File angles.txt as an Input resource with geometry Non-Geographical [n_objects = 1]

movie [INFORMATION]: Single master plot (frame 0) built: anim_02.ps

movie [DEBUG]: gmtapi_garbage_collection: Destroying object: C=0 A=1 ID=0 W=Input F=Data Table M=File S=Used P=2e9e4a8f3a0 N=angles.txt
movie (gmt_free_table): tried to free unallocated memory
movie [DEBUG]: GMTAPI_Garbage_Collection freed 1 memory objects
movie [DEBUG]: gmtapi_unregister_io: Unregistering object no 0 [n_objects = 0]
movie [DEBUG]: GMT memory: Free 2 temporary column arrays, each of length : 2097152
gmt.exe [DEBUG]: Entering GMT_Destroy_Session
```

Please run movie with -Qs, then cd into the directory with the scripts and run one of the scripts, e.g.,

stuff_frame.sh 20

20 is just a particular frame, depending on # of frames you may use 020.

I'll try to look into this in an hour but I'm f with WSL. Now Windows/System32/bash.exe manages to get in front of everything and I can't run the tests. Even if I move it out of the may ctest complains that it doesn't find it. HTF does it knows that it even existed?

Found a small bug. The movie_frame.sh shows:
```
export GMT_SESSION_NAME=$$
GMT_END_SHOW=off
```
It should be:
```
export GMT_SESSION_NAME=$$
export GMT_END_SHOW=off
```
I see it, fixing now - just running local tests first.

Run ``anim_02.sh`` and it worked fine. But also got this error message

```
bash anim_02.sh
gmt [ERROR]: Failed to remove C:/Users/joaqu/.gmt/server/gmt_hash_server.txt.new! [remove error: No such file or directory]
```
OK, will need to improve that to check if the file exists first.
Still doesn't work. No errors but also no PS generated.
Is the test running the bash version in WIndows bash for git on CI? So I should be able to reproduce this manually running bash for git on my Win10 Dell?
Yes, we use bash for git on CI.
Hm, but I cannot build for Windows.  Anyway you can run a small example movie like the first example on the movie man page but add -Qs and examine or tar up the content of that directory?
Please see the attached. [globe.zip](https://github.com/GenericMappingTools/gmt/files/3737059/globe.zip)
It works for me, but runs only in a single core. Even if I add a **-x** to the movie command.

Running one frame gives me following error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3974108/67030962-8e297b80-f0de-11e9-811f-88153f9fd9e3.png)

The movie_frame.sh can't source `movie_init.sh`, but it's definitely in the current directory.

Then I change the movie_frame.sh to:
```
source ./movie_init.sh
source ./movie_params_$1.sh
```
it works.
**Update:** `bash movie_frame.sh 000` works but `sh movie_frame.sh 000` fails.

Sorry if my comments above confuse you.

The example in the gmt movie man page works, but the anim01 doesn't work. Please see the attached tarball for anim01. [anim_01.zip](https://github.com/GenericMappingTools/gmt/files/3740651/anim_01.zip)

The bug is caused by the last few lines of the movie_master.sh script:
```
# Move master file up to top directory and cd up one level
mv -f anim_01.ps C:\gmt\doc\examples\anim01
cd ..
```
I think we need to change the path separator `/`.

So getcw returns a path with backslash but then the shell cannot process them... Brilliant.

Of course, we have had this before and hence the gmt_replace_backslash_in_path function.  I will apply that to the workdir path as well.

Are you guys getting multi-processor runs when running the movie examples?
It certainly does not work on Windows when running bash scripts, but I think we tested and it worked when running batch files (there, we use ``cmd /B``)

If bash script is passed, on windows, we set GMT_SESSION_NAME=$$ so that part should work in bash.  Once we make rc5 I should be able to install on my Dell and try in git bash.  Should be multi-core runs if gmt --show-cores returns > 1 no ?
The bash animations now pass on Windows CI.

I will drink to that, except I will be teaching first...
Can you confirm that many cores are being used - i.e., @joa-quim's point?
Multi-core works on macOS, but not sure if it works on Windows, as my Windows is in a single-core virtual machine.
OK, I can test on my Dell with rc4 for that question I think

While slow, my Dell reports 7 available core (we subtract one for the movie process itself) and I can see it starts 7 jobs at the same time, then sits there for a while, then start 7 more.  So I think all is working well - closing this issue?

Hm, if we are talking bash then that & puts it in the background.  It is not sitting there to complete the job since it is launching 7 such system calls and then waits for completion.  I am running bit bash in Win 10.  Are you talking Windows batch now?
BTW, I agree that the & etc is probably not what to do for batch files under Windows.  But you said you think it is working find on Windows.

No, I'm talking ``anim_02.sh``. With -Vd I can perfectly see that the lines ``Launch script for frame XX`` take about 1-2 sec to print and the ones ``Frame 00 of 37 completed`` to ``Frame 10 of 37 completed`` are printed instantaneously. That is it waits till the 11 jobs are run, ONE by ONE, and then prints de info for the 11 all at once.

I'm running Git bash. 

```
movie [INFORMATION]: Build frames using 11 cores
movie [INFORMATION]: Execute movie frame scripts in parallel
movie [DEBUG]: Launch script for frame 00
movie [DEBUG]: Launch script for frame 01
movie [DEBUG]: Launch script for frame 02
movie [DEBUG]: Launch script for frame 03

movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 00 of 37 completed [  2.7 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 01 of 37 completed [  5.4 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 02 of 37 completed [  8.1 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 03 of 37 completed [ 10.8 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 04 of 37 completed [ 13.5 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 05 of 37 completed [ 16.2 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 06 of 37 completed [ 18.9 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 07 of 37 completed [ 21.6 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 08 of 37 completed [ 24.3 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 09 of 37 completed [ 27.0 %]
movie [INFORMATION]: Frame 10 of 37 completed [ 29.7 %]
```
